pr_title: Update the debug flags for the Assembly source

timeline.message:
Update the debug flags for the Assembly source

Updated debug flags will add additional debug information for GNU
debuggers such as GDB for linux systems about assembly glue code used in
JIT.

Signed-off-by: Rahil Shah <rahil@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to update CMake as well? @dnakamura FYI. Also will this flag affect performance? Not sure if gcc would do any performance passes on an assembly file. My guess would be no but worth asking.
timeline.author: fjeremic

replies.bodyText:
Also will this flag affect performance? Not sure if gcc would do any performance passes on an assembly file.

I do not think so, it would and even this would added to debug build when we build the JIT with BUILD_CONFIG=debug and won't affect the prod builds.
The only concern  I have is the statement on the man page which says it will break other live debuggers on Linux, I am not aware of any other we use.
replies.author: r30shah
